title: Regio VI (Alta Semita)
description: The sixth administrative regio of Augustan Rome, Regio VI (Alta Semita) derives its name from the street that crossed over the Quirinal Hill. This is a large district that includes the Viminal Hill, the lower slopes of the Pincian Hill, in addition to the valleys between these hills. The region also contained 17 aediculae (shrines), 146 domÅ«s (patrician houses), 18 horrea (warehouses), 75 bath houses, and 73 fountains.
